excerpt: Upscale Marina Vallarta is a modern, planned development known for elegant hotels and resorts, sandy beaches, and a large marina that’s home to luxury yachts. Upmarket boutiques and restaurants serving global fare line a pedestrian boardwalk, and the landmark El Faro lighthouse has a rooftop bar with views of the marina and hills beyond. The area’s namesake 18-hole public golf course features lagoons and palm trees.
detail_description: Marina Vallarta is a sophisticated and well-planned area featuring luxurious hotels, sandy beaches, and a bustling marina filled with opulent yachts. The waterfront boardwalk is lined with high-end boutiques and restaurants offering diverse cuisine. Visitors can enjoy panoramic views of the marina and surrounding hills from the rooftop bar at the iconic El Faro lighthouse.
name: Marina Vallarta
address: 48335 Puerto Vallarta, Jalisco, Mexico

excerpt: Zona Romántica is a trendy area filled with lively expat and LGBT bars, plus restaurants serving global fare. Quaint courtyard cafes and contemporary art galleries sit alongside boutique hotels on cobblestone streets. The popular Los Muertos Beach draws locals and visitors to its broad, curved pier, which lights up at night. Lázaro Cárdenas Park hosts the Olas Altas Farmers Market in winter and spring.
detail_description: Zona Romántica, also known as the Romantic Zone, is a vibrant neighborhood in Puerto Vallarta that offers a mix of cultural charm and modern attractions. This trendy area features a variety of lively bars, global cuisine restaurants, quaint courtyard cafes, and contemporary art galleries. The cobblestone streets are lined with boutique hotels and abundant foliage, creating an intimate atmosphere for visitors.
name: Zona Romántica
address: Emiliano Zapata, Puerto Vallarta, Jalisco, Mexico

excerpt: Residential street with low, colorful houses & palm trees, offering a distant view of the hills.
detail_description: Los Arcos, also known as the Arches of Mismaloya, is a popular day-trip destination in Puerto Vallarta. The area is famous for its natural beauty and biodiversity both above and below water. Hollywood movies like The Night of the Iguana have been filmed at this pristine beach, which offers stunning views and opportunities for snorkeling among colorful varieties of fish. Visitors can also enjoy kayaking or sailing while capturing the amazing landscape with their cameras.
name: Los Arcos
address: Jardines del Puerto, 48315 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: 12-block promenade offering ocean views & sculptures, plus restaurants, bars, galleries & shops.
detail_description: Puerto Vallarta Malecon is a captivating 12-block promenade that offers stunning ocean views, adorned with sculptures, and lined with an array of restaurants, bars, galleries, and shops. It's considered a must-visit in Puerto Vallarta to truly experience the city's vibrant atmosphere while strolling along the beachfront. The Malecon features local vendors, art installations, and sand sculptures that add to its charm.
name: Puerto Vallarta Malecon
address: Paseo Díaz Ordaz S/N, Centro, 48300 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: Big, action-packed beach with food & drink vendors, water sports operators & a pier for boat trips.
detail_description: Los Muertos Beach is a bustling and lively spot in Puerto Vallarta, known for its vibrant atmosphere and variety of activities. Legend has it that the beach got its name from ancient tombs discovered when homes were first built along the coast. The iconic dock, resembling a spiraling conch shell, adds to the unique charm of this beach. Visitors can indulge in fresh-caught shrimp and refreshing drinks from local vendors or relax at palapa-lined bars and restaurants.
name: Los Muertos Beach
address: Jalisco, Mexico

excerpt: Puerto Vallarta is a resort town on Mexico’s Pacific coast, in Jalisco state. It is known for its beaches, water sports and nightlife scene. Its cobblestone center is home to the ornate Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe church, boutique shops and a range of restaurants and bars. El Malecón is a beachside promenade with contemporary sculptures, as well as bars, lounges and nightclubs.
detail_description: Puerto Vallarta, located on Mexico's Pacific coast in Jalisco state, is a popular resort town known for its beautiful beaches, water sports, and vibrant nightlife. The cobblestone center features the ornate Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe church, boutique shops, and a variety of dining and entertainment options. Visitors can stroll along El Malecón, a beachside promenade adorned with contemporary sculptures and lined with bars, lounges, and nightclubs.
name: Puerto Vallarta
address: Jalisco, Mexico

excerpt: Conchas Chinas is an affluent colonia directly south of Puerto Vallarta in the state of Jalisco, on the Pacific coast of Mexico. The term Conchas Chinas means "Curled Shells" referring to the type of shell found only on the beaches of Conchas Chinas. Locals in Puerto Vallarta refer to Conchas Chinas as "The Hills". Wikipedia.
detail_description: Conchas Chinas, which means "Curled Shells" in Spanish, is an upscale neighborhood located just south of Puerto Vallarta in Jalisco, Mexico. This coastal area is known for its picturesque beaches and hidden coves. The local beach, Playa Punta Negra, is a popular spot with visitors due to its secluded feel and stunning natural beauty. Accessible by bus, this beach offers a serene escape with a long staircase leading down to the shore.
name: Conchas Chinas
address: 48399 Puerto Vallarta, Jalisco, Mexico

detail_description: If you're planning a trip to Puerto Vallarta, make sure to include the enchanting "Rhythms of the Night" dinner show on your itinerary. This captivating experience is perfect for families and combines elements reminiscent of Cirque du Soleil with a delightful dining atmosphere. The adventure begins with a scenic sunset cruise across Banderas Bay, leading you to the stunning Las Caletas beach.
name: Rhythms of the Night
address: 48333, H. Escuela Naval Militar 9, Área Militar de Vallarta, 48333 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

detail_description: Restaurant El Malecón is located near the Malecon Beach in Puerto Vallarta. The beach is not popular for swimming, but it offers a beautiful sunset spot and is filled with street performers, vendors, and vibrant colors. Visitors can enjoy amazing street food while strolling down the Malecon and watching fireworks from the boardwalk.
name: Restaurant El Malecón
address: Paseo Díaz Ordaz 895, Centro, 48300 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: River island with trails through jungle with parrots & iguanas, a craft market & a cultural museum.
detail_description: Isla Cuale is a charming river island located in Puerto Vallarta, offering a unique blend of nature, culture, and shopping experiences. Accessible via footbridges or suspension cable bridges, this leafy pedestrian-only island is home to a vibrant crafts market where visitors can find an array of locally made art, handicrafts, and souvenirs.
name: Isla Cuale
address: Zona Romántica, Emiliano Zapata, 48380 Puerto Vallarta, Jalisco, Mexico

excerpt: 4 stone arches on a bayside promenade, the backdrop for an amphitheater & a sunset vantage point.
detail_description: Los Arcos is a famous landmark in Puerto Vallarta, consisting of four stone arches located on a bayside promenade. It serves as the backdrop for an amphitheater and offers a stunning vantage point to witness breathtaking sunsets. The area around Banderas Bay provides various activities such as snorkeling at Los Arcos, yoga in Bucerias, hiking to Quimixto, and clubbing at the Malecon.
name: Los Arcos
address: Malecón s/n, Centro, 48300 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: Long, sandy coastline backed by resort hotels, with tidal pools around jagged rocks & strong waves.
detail_description: Conchas Chinas Beach, located just 3km south of downtown Puerto Vallarta, is a small cove with soft tawny sand and tranquil turquoise waters. It's popular among families for its shallow waters and sheltered pools, making it ideal for children. The beach offers opportunities for snorkeling around the rock reef and exploring numerous tide pools.
name: Conchas Chinas Beach
address: Jalisco, Mexico

detail_description: The Malecón in Puerto Vallarta is a must-visit spot, known as the most recognized symbol of the city. This seafront promenade has been attracting tourists and residents since the 1930s and is filled with unique sculptures and statues along its mile-long stretch. From the famous seahorse sculpture to the Puerto Vallarta sign, there are plenty of photo opportunities.
name: Malecón
address: Paseo de La Ribera, 48290 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: Large ocean pier boasting a sleek, contemporary design & picturesque coastline views.
detail_description: Los Muertos Beach Pier, located in Puerto Vallarta, underwent a major transformation in 2013 and is now a sleek and contemporary structure that has become a prominent landmark. Visitors can enjoy leisurely activities such as strolling along the pier, swimming in the ocean, shopping at nearby shops, or taking a bike ride. The pier also serves as a starting point for day trips to various islands and beaches.
name: Los Muertos Beach Pier
address: Francisca Rodríguez 121, Zona Romántica, Emiliano Zapata, 48380 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

name: La cruz del cerro
address: Cerro, 48304 Puerto Vallarta, Jalisco, Mexico

detail_description: Vallarta Tequila Tastings offers an authentic experience of tasting tequila in Puerto Vallarta. Oscars Distillery, located near the Malecon, provides a great opportunity to learn about and taste real Mexican tequila. Additionally, Vallarta Tequila Tastings is highly rated and offers tastings at their patio in the Versalles neighborhood or can arrange house calls for private events. Visitors can also explore various types of tequilas by dropping into local shops around town.
name: Vallarta Tequila Tastings
address: Hamburgo 150-C, Versalles, 48310 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

detail_description: Los Veranos Canopy Tour Whale Watching offers an unforgettable family adventure in Puerto Vallarta, especially between December and March when majestic humpback whales migrate to Banderas Bay. This is the perfect time to witness these incredible creatures as they breach and swim in their natural habitat. Families can create lasting memories while enjoying the thrill of spotting both adult and baby humpbacks during a guided tour. With friendly staff ensuring a fun atmosphere, guests can expect informative commentary about these magnificent animals.
name: Los Veranos Canopy Tour Whale Watching
address: Blvd. Francisco Medina Ascencio 2735 - Local 5 Zona Hotelera Norte, CP 48333, 48390 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

detail_description: TOURS SCUBA ALFARO DIVING is highly recommended for their exceptional service and dedication to fulfilling additional requests. The team goes above and beyond to assist with special occasions, such as helping with a marriage proposal on Playa del Love. The tours are personalized, ensuring a memorable experience for each guest. With fair prices and a convenient location, this company is the go-to choice for various tours in the Puerto Vallarta area.
name: TOURS SCUBA ALFARO DIVING
address: Marina Nacional 229, Zona Hotelera, Zona Hotelera Nte., 48333 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: This large, whimsical pirate ship with costumed guides offers land tours & sailing adventures.
detail_description: Marigalante is a large pirate ship that offers both land tours and sailing adventures in Puerto Vallarta. During the day, families can enjoy activities such as kayaking, snorkeling, beach volleyball, and an action-packed show on board. The ship provides a children's menu in the air-conditioned dining room below deck while adults can take advantage of the open bar.
name: Marigalante
address: Paseo Díaz Ordaz Local 4, Centro, 48300 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: Busy weekend market offering a variety of handmade crafts & trinkets, plus food items.
detail_description: The Olas Altas Saturday Market is a bustling weekend market located in Puerto Vallarta's Zona Romantica. It combines the traditional style of tianguis with a modern American Mercado, offering a wide array of handmade crafts, trinkets, and food items. Visitors can find everything from farm-fresh produce and gourmet chocolates to artisan cheeses and handmade pottery.
name: Olas Altas Saturday Market
address: Lázaro Cárdenas, Zona Romántica, Emiliano Zapata, 48380 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: Protected urban estuary on 169 hectares with biologist-guided boat tours of reptile & bird habitats.
detail_description: Área Natural Protegida Estero El Salado is a hidden gem in Puerto Vallarta, spanning 169 hectares between the hotel zone and the airport. This urban estuary offers biologist-guided boat tours that provide an up-close look at reptile and bird habitats. Despite being located in a major tourist area, this natural habitat remains relatively unknown to some visitors.
name: Área Natural Protegida Estero El Salado
address: Av. Francisco Medina Ascencio 3544, Villa Las Flores, 48335 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: Sizable water park offering slides & unique play features, plus an option to swim with dolphins.
detail_description: Aquaventuras Park is a vibrant water park nestled in Nuevo Vallarta, perfect for families seeking a day of fun and adventure. This expansive venue features thrilling water slides like the Teeth Breaker and Happy Widow, alongside relaxing options such as a lazy river and inner tube rides. For younger visitors or those less confident in the water, the Little Water World offers shallow pools filled with engaging play features.
name: Aquaventuras Park
address: Carretera a Tepic Km 155 S/N México 200 lt 140, Bahía de Banderas, 02108 Pueblo de Acoma, 63732 Nuevo Vallarta, Nay., Mexico

detail_description: Nestled along the northern banks of the Cuale River in downtown Puerto Vallarta, the Cuale Island Flea Market is a vibrant hub for local shopping enthusiasts. Just a short stroll from the main square, this expansive market occupies an entire city block and features two levels brimming with unique finds. Visitors can browse through an eclectic mix of handmade jewelry, colorful apparel, charming home decor items, and delightful trinkets that capture the essence of Mexican craftsmanship.
name: Cuale Island Flea Market
address: Zona Romántica, Emiliano Zapata, 48380 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: The city’s entertainment hub, Centro draws crowds to the waterfront Malecón boardwalk, popular for evening strolls, late-night bars, and nightclubs. The Our Lady of Guadalupe church, with a Renaissance-style tower, stands in the main square. Al fresco restaurants dot the leafy Cuale river island, connected to the posh Gringo Gulch area by a footbridge. Galleries and flea markets sell local art and Huichol crafts.
detail_description: Centro is a vibrant entertainment district located along the waterfront Malecón boardwalk, offering evening strolls, late-night bars, and nightclubs. The area features the striking Our Lady of Guadalupe church in the main square and al fresco restaurants on the leafy Cuale river island. Visitors can explore galleries and flea markets selling local art and Huichol crafts.
name: Centro
address: Puerto Vallarta, Jalisco, Mexico

detail_description: The Malecon Boardwalk in Vallarta is the heart and soul of the town, offering a vibrant mix of art, culture, and entertainment. This iconic waterfront esplanade spans almost one kilometer and features sculptures by renowned artists, art galleries, shops, and restaurants. Visitors can enjoy open-air performances at Los Arcos amphitheater while taking in stunning views of the Pacific Ocean. The lively atmosphere includes street artists selling their wares and bustling shops, bars, and cafes.
name: Malecon Boardwalk Vallarta
address: Paseo Díaz Ordaz s/n, Centro, 48300 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: Elegant tasting menus with  a vegetarian option, plus live music & a garden terrace.
detail_description: Café des Artistes is a fine dining venue located in Puerto Vallarta, offering elegant tasting menus with a vegetarian option. The restaurant features live music and a garden terrace, providing a charming ambiance for diners. Situated in the heart of Old Town, this establishment is part of the vibrant culinary scene in the area, which includes numerous gay-friendly eateries offering diverse cuisines such as German, Mexican, Italian, international dishes, American fare, seafood specialties, and Mex-Tex cuisine.
name: Café des Artistes
address: C. Guadalupe Sánchez 740, Centro, 48300 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

detail_description: Los Muertos Brewing is a vibrant and casual craft brewery located in the Zona Romantica of Puerto Vallarta. They offer a diverse selection of over 14 beers on tap, including IPAs, hand-crafted ales, stouts, and seasonal favorites. The brewery also serves typical bar food such as various dips, chicken tenders, hot wings, hamburgers, and quesadillas to complement the beer.
name: Los Muertos Brewing
address: Lázaro Cárdenas 302, Zona Romántica, Emiliano Zapata, 48380 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: Suspension bridge over the Cuale River & a forested canyon, part of a popular ATV tour route.
detail_description: Jorullo Bridge is a must-visit attraction in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico. It is the longest vehicular suspension bridge in the world, spanning 470 meters over the Cuale River and a forested canyon. Visitors can embark on an exhilarating ATV tour through jungle trails, hills, and streams before reaching the impressive bridge. The journey offers stunning panoramic views of lush mountains and the river below.
name: Jorullo Bridge
address: Camino Los Llanito km. 4.5 Los Almacenes, 48373 Puerto Vallarta, Jal Camino Los LLanitos KM 4.5 Los Almacenes, 48373, 48373 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

detail_description: When staying at Garza Blanca in Puerto Vallarta, you can conveniently shop for swimwear, beach essentials, jewelry, and souvenirs at a small boutique located just outside the resort's lobby. This on-site shop offers a convenient alternative to venturing into town for shopping.
name: Garza Blanca
address: Puerto Vallarta, Jalisco, Mexico

detail_description: Puerto Vallarta Walking Tours offer an insightful exploration of the city's sculptures along the Malecon. Led by certified guides from the Municipal Tourism Office, these 2-hour tours provide historical context and end with refreshments at Galeria Pacifico. Visitors praise the knowledgeable and friendly guides, such as Sandra and Reinhard, who share captivating stories about local scenes, Mexican history, and culture.
name: Puerto Vallarta Walking Tours
address: Insurgenetes at V. Caranza, Emiliano Zapata, 48380 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

detail_description: The Turtle Release Point for Baby Turtles is a heartwarming experience that leaves a lasting impression. The best time to witness this event is between July and December when the newborn turtles make their way to the ocean. Olive Ridley sea turtles return annually to the Bay of Banderas to lay their eggs, with hatching season typically occurring from July to October. Visitors can inquire about this activity through hotel concierges or keep an eye on social media pages for release announcements.
name: Turtle release point for baby Turtles
address: Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

detail_description: Oceanfriendly Whale Watching Tours offer an unforgettable experience for families visiting Puerto Vallarta during the winter months. From December to mid-February or March, you can witness the breathtaking sight of humpback whales as they migrate from the Arctic to Banderas Bay to breed and nurture their young. This natural spectacle allows you to create lasting memories while observing these magnificent creatures in their habitat.
name: Ocean Friendly Tours
address: 48333, Isla Iguana, 48333 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

detail_description: Puerto Vallarta International Airport (PVR), also known as Licenciado Gustavo Diaz Ordaz International Airport, serves as the main gateway to this tropical paradise. It offers direct flights from major cities like Los Angeles and Seattle, making it easily accessible for travelers. Situated just 20 minutes north of downtown Puerto Vallarta, the airport is conveniently located and easily accessible via affordable transportation options such as Uber.
name: Puerto Vallarta International Airport (PVR)
address: Blvd. Francisco Medina Ascencio 7930, Área Militar de Vallarta, 48335 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

detail_description: Plaza Mar on Los Muertos Beach in Old Town Puerto Vallarta is a historic area with cobblestone streets and a village-like atmosphere, offering quaint shops and stylish restaurants. The location provides a great central spot for exploring the area, with easy access to the beach, food, and markets. The rooftop pool offers stunning 360-degree views of the surroundings. Guests have praised the clean and well-furnished condos as well as the friendly staff.
name: Plaza Mar on Los Muertos Beach in Old Town Puerto Vallarta
address: Condominios Plazamar, Lázaro Cárdenas 155, Zona Romántica, Emiliano Zapata, 48380 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

name: VALLARTA LOCAL Food Tour in Pitillal
address: Emiliano Zapata 199, Centro Pitillal, 48290 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

detail_description: Act2PV Theater is a versatile entertainment venue located in Puerto Vallarta's Zona Romantica. It offers a diverse range of shows, including musicals, plays, drag shows, and concerts in both English and Spanish. The theater features multiple performance spaces, such as the Main Stage Playhouse and the intimate Red Room Cabaret. With a gay-friendly atmosphere and staff, Act2PV provides an array of entertainment options for various interests.
name: Act2PV Theater
address: Basilio Badillo & Insurgentes 339, Basilio Badillo, Zona Romántica, 48380 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: Known for its crowned Renaissance-style tower, this iconic city church hosts an annual festival.
detail_description: The Parroquia de Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe, located in the heart of Puerto Vallarta, is a beloved city landmark with its Renaissance-style tower topped by a crown. Construction began in 1903 and it has since become an iconic symbol for the locals. The church hosts important religious celebrations and is surrounded by constant activity. A pedestrian street lined with shops leads to the cathedral entrance, where Sunday services are well attended.
name: Parroquia de Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe
address: Hidalgo 370, Proyecto escola, Centro, 48300 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: Colonial-style spot with model ships & other exhibits on Mexico's naval history, plus a coffee shop.
detail_description: The Naval Museum Secretary of the Navy of Mexico in Puerto Vallarta is a colonial-style museum that offers a captivating journey through Mexico's maritime history. Managed by the Government of Mexico, this museum showcases the nation's naval heritage from ancient times to modern accomplishments. Visitors can explore exhibits featuring model ships, navigation instruments, charts, images, and scale models. The museum also provides free guided tours, an audio-visual hall, a gift shop, and a cafeteria.
name: Naval Museum Secretary of the Navy of Mexico
address: C. Zaragoza 4, Centro, 48300 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: A climb up steep steps leads to panoramic views at the top of this contemporary, open-work tower.
detail_description: Hill of the Cross Viewpoint, also known as Mirador de Cerro de La Cruz, is a contemporary tower situated atop Cerro La Cruz in Puerto Vallarta. The climb to the viewpoint is challenging, with steep steps and grooved streets, making it essential to wear comfortable shoes and bring water. However, the effort is rewarded with breathtaking panoramic views of Puerto Vallarta's bay and stunning sunsets.
name: Hill of the Cross Viewpoint
address: Abasolo LB, Cerro, 48304 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: Twisting paths up & down to the beach wind alongside this city promenade with views over the sea.
detail_description: The Malecon in Puerto Vallarta is a must-visit, offering a mile-long pedestrian boardwalk with stunning views of the sea. The area is adorned with palm trees, sculptures, and various activities for locals and tourists alike. It's recommended to bring water, a hat, and comfortable shoes due to the potentially oppressive temperatures. Visitors can enjoy walking, biking, shopping for local and international goods, as well as dining at bars and restaurants with ocean views.
name: Malecon
address: Centro, 48300 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: Upscale hillside residential area named for foreigners who lived there, including Elizabeth Taylor.
detail_description: Gringo Gulch is an upscale residential area located in historic downtown Puerto Vallarta, known for its association with the famous love story between Elizabeth Taylor and Richard Burton. Developed in the 1950s by Fernando Freddy Romero, this neighborhood preserves traditional Mexican architecture and ambiance, standing out from contemporary architectural trends.
name: Gringo Gulch
address: C. Zaragoza 373, Centro, 48380 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: Humble cultural museum with exhibits on the area's history, including archaeological artifacts.
detail_description: Museo del Cuale, located on Isla Rio Cuale in Puerto Vallarta, is a small yet captivating museum showcasing the history and archaeology of the region's original inhabitants. The museum boasts an impressive collection of pre-Hispanic ceramics dating back to 5000-2000 A.C., providing insight into the indigenous peoples of western Mexico. Exhibits include hunting and gathering tools, artwork, and a tomb excavated from Sayula Zacoalco in Jalisco.
name: Museo del Cuale
address: Isla de los Niños del Río Coale s/n Centro, Morelos 101-Local 3B, Centro, 48300 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

detail_description: Los Veranos Canopy Tour offers a thrilling zip lining experience in Puerto Vallarta. The adventure begins with a scenic boat ride across the bay to Boca de Tomatlan, followed by a shuttle ride to the zip line park. Visitors can expect a fast-paced and fun-filled experience as they soar through the treetops. Families looking for kid-friendly activities can also explore Nogalito Ecopark, which features the exciting Los Veranos Canopy Tour.
name: Los Veranos Canopy Tour (Main Office)
address: Blvd. Francisco Medina Ascencio 2735, Zona Hotelera, Zona Hotelera Nte., 48333 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

detail_description: Galerias Vallarta Shopping Mall is the main shopping destination in Puerto VallartaRiviera Nayarit, offering 73,000 square feet of retail space spread across two floors. Visitors can enjoy a stunning view of arriving cruise ships while exploring a variety of shops catering to both cruise-ship passengers and Mexican visitors. The mall features two escalators, restaurants, parking facilities, a 12-theater cinema, and a fast-food court with popular chains like McDonald's and Starbucks.
name: Galerias Vallarta Shopping Mall
address: Av. Francisco Medina Ascencio 2920, Educación, 48338 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: Busy local market with stalls for Jalisco-region folk art & jewelry, plus pozole soup & beef tacos.
detail_description: Mercado Municipal Rio Cuale is a bustling local market in Puerto Vallarta, offering a wide variety of goods and food. It's known for its stalls selling Jalisco-region folk art, jewelry, and traditional dishes like pozole soup and beef tacos. The market is located between El Centro and Colonia Emiliano Zapata, providing an informal and fun shopping experience.
name: Mercado Municipal Rio Cuale
address: Agustín Rodríguez s/n, Centro, 48300 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

detail_description: Nestled in the charming cobblestone streets, Mundo de Azulejos is a treasure trove for tile enthusiasts and lovers of Mexican craftsmanship. This expansive shop offers an impressive array of Talavera tiles, each one meticulously hand-painted and glazed to perfection. Whether you're on the hunt for unique mosaic scenes or practical items like soap dishes and plates, you'll find something that catches your eye starting at just 20 MXN ($1).
name: Mundo de Azulejos
address: Venustiano Carranza 374, Zona Romántica, Emiliano Zapata, 48380 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: Puerto Vallarta airport offering domestic flights & service to major cities in the U.S. & Canada.
detail_description: Licenciado Gustavo Díaz Ordaz International Airport, located in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, is a hub for domestic flights and offers services to major cities in the U.S. and Canada. The airport serves as a gateway to popular tourist destinations such as Puerto Vallarta, Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, and the Riviera Nayarit. With its vibrant nightlife and stunning scenery, this area in Mexico's Jalisco state on the Pacific coast attracts visitors from around the world.
name: Licenciado Gustavo Díaz Ordaz International Airport
address: Carretera a Tepic Km 7.5, Área Militar de Vallarta, 48311 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

detail_description: The Old Town Market, located in Lazaro Cardenas Park, is a vibrant and bustling farmers market that takes place every Saturday. With over 90 stalls offering a wide variety of local produce, handmade crafts, clothing, home decor, baked goods, and more, visitors can immerse themselves in the lively atmosphere while being entertained by local musicians. The market is a great place to find fresh ingredients for a home-cooked meal or to pick up unique gifts and souvenirs.
name: Old Town Market
address: Lázaro Cárdenas 315, Zona Romántica, Emiliano Zapata, 48380 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico

excerpt: Whimsical waterpark featuring various pools, a pirate ship & serpentine slides, plus a tiki bar.
detail_description: Splash Parque Acuatico Vallarta is an entertaining and playful waterpark that boasts a range of pools, slides and attractions including a pirate ship. It's perfect for families with children of all ages as there are options for both little kids and older ones. The park also has an impressive selection of marine life such as dolphins, sea lions and even sharks to observe or interact with. Additionally, guests can enjoy refreshments at the tiki bar while taking in the aquatic scenery.
name: Splash Parque Acuatico Vallarta
address: Vallarta, Jacarandas, 63735 Nuevo Vallarta, Nay., Mexico

excerpt: Short thoroughfare with a simple, tree-lined park on one side & compact houses on the other.
detail_description: Las Animas is a charming coastal area with a simple, tree-lined park and compact houses. Despite its secluded beaches, it offers various amenities such as food, drinks, and activities. The beach features palapa-style restaurants and a fun floatable area that kids will enjoy. Visitors can also appreciate the beautiful landscape while dining at seafood restaurants in the area.
name: Las Animas
address: Jardines del Puerto, 48315 Puerto Vallarta, Jal., Mexico
